pros: Supportive of CPD and progression routes. Good benefit scheme for saving money. Governors and senior managers recognise the financial crisis taking place and have paid incentives to all staff. Managers listen and act upon issues.
cons: I live too far away but drive the distance because it is a good place to work

pros: Lots of opportunities everyone was friendly, lots of perks
cons: Pay wasn’t great but not the worst

review_title: BCoT is the place to be!
job_title: Head of Construction in Basingstoke, England
pros: There is no doubt the Further Education is a challenging sector to work in. However, it can be enormously rewarding. If passing on your experience and knowledge to other people, ensuring the success of what sector/career you are passionate about, than there is no better place to do it than BCoT!
cons: “Nothing in the world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort" - ― Theodore Roosevelt.

pros: collaborative, motivational and friendly working environment. Support is in place to develop staff skills and give opportunity for promotion and advancement. Senior managers are supportive and encouraging. I feel valued and listened to.
cons: There are not cons to working at BCoT

pros:
Some nice people
Good experience, 
Staff are dedicated to the students success
cons:
Management training lacking
Not much progression

job_title: Teaching Support Assistant in Basingstoke, England
pros: great company of people to work with, lots of progression opps
cons: low salary makes it hard to stay put

review_title: A College that puts the student needs first
pros: A forward thinking establishment. Willing to take chances. Puts the students first.  Looks at what students need and has great links with employers to help shape the curriculum and to ensure we are making students ready for employment.
cons: Long hours in term time but not unlike any education establishment. Limited to what we can do due to funding.

pros: Some of the genuine people are lovely, free parking, clean toilets, nice Buildings, food in canteen is ok but not great, restaurant is amazing...
cons: Principal, management, programs that are not functioning correctly, Chinese whispers, lying culture, full of back stabbers, two faced people are rife!

pros: supportive , friendly, good IT and food
cons: not enough money for everything  ( a problem for most colleges i expect)
HODs and Senior Management didn't understand how to teach or run our department due to them being hired from an entirely different department / subject.
